items.summary: Dhanteras: In the past, Dhanteras was regarded as the most fortunate day to invest in metals, especially gold, silver, or brass, as these were believed to not only attract but also retain luck and wealth.

items.title: Dixon Technologies posts 81% jump in quarterly profit on new contracts
items.summary: Dixon Technologies saw an 81% profit surge driven by new contracts. The company is investing Rs 3,000 crore in its components business over the next two to three years. This move aims to maintain margins after smartphone production incentives end. Dixon is also exploring IT hardware growth and export opportunities.

items.title: ET Graphics: India’s AI hardware imports jump 13% to $66.8 billion, US share rises
items.summary: India's imports of AI-enabling goods surged by 13.1% to $66.8 billion in FY25, with the US contributing significantly. Processors, controllers, and memories from the US now form over half of India's AI-related imports, highlighting a growing dependence on American advanced computing hardware for its burgeoning AI ecosystem.

items.title: Fusion wear becomes Diwali Showstopper as shoppers prefer stylish dresses, suits over traditional outfits
items.summary: Ethnic fashion sales are down this festive season. Consumers, especially younger urban shoppers, prefer western and fusion wear for comfort and style. This shift impacts traditional garments. While some premium ethnic wear remains strong, the overall trend shows a preference for western styles. Fusion wear offers a blend of ethnic essence with modern appeal.

items.title: Bitcoin drops under $106,000 to hit its lowest level in months, Binance-linked coin also struggles — Here's why
items.summary: Crypto markets are in turmoil, with Bitcoin falling 4% and losing its status as a safe asset. Over $600 billion has been wiped from the crypto market, largely due to trade tensions between the US and China, prompting significant investor withdrawals.

items.title: Assocham to propose measures to cut imports
items.summary: ASSOCHAM plans to propose cross-sectoral measures to the Centre aimed at reducing India's import dependence, specifying potential import reduction quantum for implemented interventions. These long-term strategies will focus on policy changes and incentives, with a study to identify single-country import dependencies. The industry is also exploring alternative technologies to counter disruptions like China's rare earth supply curbs.

items.title: China top source of imports in H1 FY26; New Delhi's trade deficit with Beijing hits $54.4 billion
items.summary: Mainland China led India's imports in the first half of FY26 with $62.89 billion, followed by the UAE. Despite a trade deficit increase with China, overall goods imports rose, indicating strong domestic demand and manufacturing activity. Electronics, machinery, and silver imports saw significant growth.

items.title: India widens hunt for rare earths — eyes Chile, Peru trade deals to ease supply
items.summary: India is actively working to secure its rare earth mineral supply. The nation is negotiating trade agreements with Chile and Peru, while also boosting domestic exploration efforts. Startups are being encouraged to participate in recycling and processing rare earth waste. These measures aim to diversify supply chains and reduce reliance on single sources, ensuring a stable future for critical minerals.

items.title: India widens hunt for rare earths — eyes Chile, Peru trade deals to ease supply
items.summary: India is actively working to secure its rare earth mineral supply. The nation is negotiating trade agreements with Chile and Peru, while also boosting domestic exploration efforts. Startups are being encouraged to participate in recycling and processing rare earth waste. These measures aim to diversify supply chains and reduce reliance on single sources, ensuring a stable future for critical minerals.

items.title: Logistics cost to be in single digits by December: Nitin Gadkari
items.summary: India's logistics cost is projected to drop to 9% by December, a significant reduction from 16% previously, driven by expressway and economic corridor expansion. This improvement aims to boost India's competitiveness in exports. The minister also highlighted the goal of making India the world's number one automobile industry within five years.

items.title: India turns to Russia to break China’s rare earth monopoly
items.summary: India is actively seeking partnerships with Russian companies to secure vital rare earth magnets and critical minerals, aiming to reduce dependence on China. This strategic move follows Beijing's recent export curbs, impacting key industries. Indian firms and research institutions are evaluating Russian processing technologies, with potential collaborations involving state-run giants like Nornickel and Rosatom.

items.title: Highway developers urge NHAI to tweak BOT agreement model
items.summary: Road developers are urging the NHAI to amend model concession agreements for BOT projects, focusing on restructuring termination payments and easing financial burdens. Recommendations include shared demand-side risk, permanent GNSS toll data, and revised prolongation cost compensation to boost project viability and attract investors.

items.title: Global Railways parts makers eye India expansion
items.summary: Global railway equipment makers are looking to invest in India. The country is set to become an export hub for railway components. India plans significant capital expenditure in railways over the next decade. New high-speed rail corridors are planned. Companies are focusing on localizing innovations and adhering to quality standards.

items.title: Embraer inaugurates India office, signs agreement with Mahindra group to develop a hub for C-390 military transport aircraft
items.summary: Embraer also plans to build capacity in India to capitalise on opportunities within the country’s aerospace and defense industry

items.title: DDA to open flat registrations for 48-storey high rise residential society in East Delhi
items.summary: The Delhi Development Authority has opened registrations for its 48-storey residential project, "DDA Towering Heights," in Karkardooma. Offering 1,026 premium two-bedroom-hall-kitchen apartments, the project is slated for handover by July 2026. This mixed-use development, the tallest in Delhi, boasts excellent connectivity via metro and road networks.

items.title: Jio Platforms Q2 net profit up 12.8% on higher data usage, strong subscriber addition
items.summary: Jio Platforms reported a 12.8% year-on-year net profit increase for the September quarter, reaching Rs 7,379 crore, driven by robust subscriber additions and higher-paying data users. The company's average revenue per user (ARPU) for its telecom business rose to Rs 211.4, with 5G subscribers now comprising 50% of its total wireless traffic.

items.title: JSW Steel eyes strong H2 as domestic demand and policy support bolster outlook
items.summary: On Friday, India’s largest steelmaker by domestic capacity reported a more than threefold jump in consolidated net profit for the September quarter, powered by higher volumes and lower input costs that offset weaker metal prices.

items.title: India Post to roll out mail, parcel services with 24-hr, 48-hr guarantee-based delivery timelines
items.summary: India Post is set to introduce guaranteed mail and parcel delivery services with 24-hour and 48-hour timelines, starting in January. This initiative aims to significantly reduce current delivery times for parcels and enhance international postal services. The government is transforming India Post into a profit center by 2029.

items.title: Sequential price weakness halves Dalmia Bharat's Q2 profit despite strong annual growth
items.summary: Despite the short-term sequential decline, the company declared an interim dividend of  ₹4 per share and reaffirmed its aggressive long-term strategy of expanding production capacity to 75 million tonnes by FY28, as well as significantly boosting its renewable energy usage.

items.title: 'Bengaluru, absolute traffic hell...: City's congestion worsens as HSR Layout flyover shuts for metro work, netizens irked
items.summary: Bengaluru HSR Layout Flyover Traffic Jam: To manage the situation, Bengaluru traffic police issued an advisory rerouting outbound traffic toward Silk Board via 19th Main. But for commuters, that was little consolation.

items.title: Tamil Nadu expands paddy storage by 3 lakh metric tonnes, total capacity exceeds 7 lakh tonnes
items.summary: Tamil Nadu is expanding its paddy storage capacity by an additional 3 lakh metric tonnes, bringing the total to over 7 lakh metric tonnes. This move comes as the state government reviews operations in Delta districts, with 4,000 Direct Procurement Centres currently active. The Tamil Nadu Civil Supplies Corporation procures paddy during the Kuruvai and Samba seasons.

items.title: ET Market Watch: Sensex surges 484 points, Nifty tops 25,700 as banks, auto & telecom lead rally
Global growth held steady in H1 2025 despite Trump’s tariff uncertainty, says IMF
items.summary: Global markets showed surprising resilience in early 2025 despite tariff shocks and geopolitical tensions. The IMF reports that growth remained robust, with economies adapting to policy shifts. Latin America and the Caribbean benefited from structural factors and strong exports, though fiscal consolidation and reforms are crucial for sustained growth.

items.title: Connplex Cinemas opens in Maharashtra, Odisha
items.summary: Connplex’s operational footprint now stands at 88 screens across 33 properties in 25 cities and 9 states

items.title: JioMart records 200+% growth in quick hyper local delivery segment
items.summary: JioMart has achieved remarkable growth in Quick Hyper-Local deliveries, surging over 200% year-on-year. The platform welcomed 5.8 million new customers in the second quarter. Reliance Retail Ventures Limited also reported robust double-digit growth across its grocery, consumer electronics, and fashion segments. The company expanded its store network significantly, further strengthening its market presence.

items.summary: The initiative, funded under the Minister’s MPLAD scheme along with the Centre and NABARD, marks a significant step toward empowering rural communities

items.title: JioFrames to make market debut in the next few months, RIL executive says
items.summary: Reliance Industries announced its AI-powered smart wearable, JioFrames, will launch in the coming months, expanding its digital ecosystem. Designed as a hands-free companion for India, JioFrames supports multiple Indian languages and offers features like HD photo/video capture, live streaming, and AI assistance for tasks such as reading, cooking, and travel.

items.summary: Reliance Industries’ Q2 net profit grew 10% YoY to Rs 18,165 crore, led by strong performance in telecom and retail segments, despite a dip in sequential profit and challenges in the O2C business.

items.title: IndiGo expands fleet with 30 additional Airbus A350-900 aircraft to enhance long-haul operations
items.summary: IndiGo has doubled its wide-body order to 60 Airbus A350-900 aircraft, converting purchase rights into a firm order for 30 additional jets. This significant expansion signals the airline's strong commitment to growing its long-haul international operations and enhancing global connectivity. Deliveries of these advanced aircraft are scheduled to commence in mid-2027.

items.title: PVR Inox logs strong quarter as footfalls, content hold firm
items.summary: PVR Inox reported a significant profit surge to Rs 127 crore, fueled by strong film content and increased audience turnout. Revenue climbed 12% to Rs 1,843 crore, with advertising revenue hitting a post-pandemic high. Despite no mega-blockbusters, mid-range films drove growth, indicating a content-led industry shift. The company is also actively reducing debt and plans screen expansion.

items.title: US sinks international deal on decarbonising ships
items.summary: An international vote to approve a global carbon pricing system for maritime emissions was delayed by a year after the United States threatened sanctions against supporting countries. The London-based International Maritime Organization (IMO) postponed the decision following opposition from the US and some oil-producing nations, citing economic concerns.

items.title: Andhra Pradesh sets 51 lakh tonne paddy procurement target for 2025-26 Kharif season: Minister
items.summary: Andhra Pradesh is gearing up for an ambitious 2025-26 Kharif season, targeting the procurement of 51 lakh tonnes of paddy. With the new government having resolved outstanding debts from its predecessor, farmers are about to experience a hassle-free registration process through WhatsApp, with promises of payment within 48 hours.

items.title: After a tough quarter, SFBs hope for credit quality, growth uptick
items.summary: Small finance banks faced profitability pressures in the second quarter due to higher credit costs and expenses. AU Small Finance Bank saw a dip in net profit, while Ujjivan and Jana reported significant drops. Lenders expressed confidence in improving credit quality from unsecured business in the coming quarter.

items.summary: The PLI scheme for white goods, with a total outlay of ₹6,238 crore, was launched in April 2021.

items.title: Automotive dealers approach Supreme Court over Rs Rs 2,500 cr compensation cess
items.summary: The Federation of Automobile Dealers Association has approached the Supreme Court seeking relief for Rs 2,500 crore in compensation cess that risks lapsing under new GST norms. FADA emphasizes that this move is for fairness and trust, aiming to prevent genuine, tax-paid credits from being lost, which would impact thousands of MSME auto dealers.

items.title: Silver surge, weak rupee lift Hindustan Zinc’s Q2 profit despite lower output
items.summary: The company's profit rose 14% on-year to  ₹2,649 crore in Q2, while revenue was up 4% at  ₹8,549 crore, its highest ever for the July-September period.

items.title: LegaXy strengthens athlete portfolio with Harshit Rana signing
items.summary: Sports and media company LegaXy has signed fast bowler Harshit Rana. LegaXy will manage his endorsements, branding, and career. Rana is a rising star for Kolkata Knight Riders. He has represented India in all formats. LegaXy aims to build his brand off the field. Rana expressed excitement for the partnership.

items.title: IHCL, Ambuja Neotia Group may expand partnership with joint investments beyond Bengal
items.summary: Indian Hotels Company Limited and Ambuja Neotia Group are considering joint investments in new hospitality projects. This expands their existing partnership. Ambuja Neotia is open to ventures outside West Bengal, leveraging IHCL's expertise. The Taj Ganga Kutir Resort & Spa at Raichak has relaunched. A hi-tech boat service is also being explored to connect Kolkata and Raichak.

Biocon Biologics will manufacture the insulin. Civica will then distribute and sell it under its own label. This move aims to improve access to essential diabetes medication for more people.

items.title: JioStar Q2FY26 net profit at Rs 1,322 crore
items.summary: JioStar reported a net profit of ₹1,322 crore for the September quarter, driven by strong performance across sports and entertainment. The media giant reached over 830 million viewers, with JioHotstar averaging 400 million monthly active users. Key content like IPL monetisation and popular shows contributed to significant revenue and viewership growth.

items.title: GAIL signs concession agreement to set up CBG Plant in Bengaluru
items.summary: GAIL India has signed a tripartite agreement with Greater Bengaluru Authority and Bengaluru Solid Waste Management to establish a Compressed Bio Gas plant in Bengaluru. The plant will process 300 tonnes of municipal solid waste daily, producing biogas and organic manure, promoting sustainable waste management and a circular economy.

items.title: DDA launches new housing scheme in East Delhi, offering 1,000 flats

Registration begins October 31, 2025. Successful bidders will pay 75% at auction and the rest by July 2026. The East Delhi Hub is a mixed-use urban centre with residential, commercial, and civic spaces.

Sensex, Nifty, Share Prices Highlights: Equity markets ended sharply higher on Thursday, with the benchmark Sensex rising 862.23 points and the Nifty scaling 25,585.30 level, tracking a rally in global markets amid US Fed rate cut hopes.

Fresh foreign fund inflows also added to the markets’ optimism.

The 30-share BSE Sensex jumped 862.23 points or 1.04 per cent to settle at 83,467.66. During the day, it zoomed 1,010.05 points or 1.22 per cent to 83,615.48.

The 50-share NSE Nifty surged 261.75 points or 1.03 per cent to 25,585.30.

From the Sensex firms, Kotak Mahindra Bank, Titan, Axis Bank

items.summary: On Tuesday, the central bank surprised the market with a 25-basis-point cut to its policy repo rate, or the rate at which it lends to banks, to 6.25 percent.

items.title: Bond bull market may pause but is far from over: Expert
items.summary: The benchmark 10-year government-security yield remained stuck in 8-7.5 percent range through all of 2015 and half of 2016, moving lower to sub-7 percent only when the RBI promised in April to reduce the system's liquidity deficit. The yield may now fall more.

items.title: Scope for meaningful rate cuts going ahead: Neelkanth Mishra
items.summary: Credit Suisse' Neelkanth Mishra expects repo rate to fall to a decade low in the coming quarters. He says that beginning December the market may see a robust and widespread pick-up which may boost indices.

items.title: Tech up to a healthier world
items.summary: Sensors, 3D printed skin, wearables, reconstructed organs, revolutionized clinical trials, personalized medicine and what not – get ready for a new era of healthcare

items.title: Steel stocks rally as govt extends MIP on 66 steel products
items.summary: Stocks like Hindustan Zinc, Hindalco, Jindal Steel, JSW Steel and Tata Steel gained over 1 percent from previous close.

items.title: Endurance Technologies IPO opens: Should you subscribe?
items.summary: The Aurangabad-based company aims to mop up nearly Rs 1,162 crore (at higher end of price band) by diluting 17.5 percent stake through the issue that will close on October 7. It already raised Rs 348.52 crore through anchor investors' portion on Tuesday, the day before issue opening.

items.title: Cautiously optimistic on India; eyeing earnings revival: Sanger
items.summary: Global liquidity tailwinds are unlikely to get any better from now and that makes Arvind Sanger, Managing Partner at Geosphere Capital Management “cautiously optimistic” on the Indian markets.

items.title: Automation threatens 69% jobs in India: World Bank
items.summary: "In large parts of Africa, it is likely that technology could fundamentally disrupt this pattern. Research based on World Bank data has predicted that the proportion of jobs threatened in India by automation is 69 percent, in China it is 77 percent and in Ethiopia, the percentage of jobs threatened by automation is 85 percent," he said.
